abstract: Bank of America’s Kenneth Lewis has made some questionable private deals, but he is a master at negotiating with the government and leveraging a weak hand to cover his missteps, The Deal Professor says.
snippet: Bank of America’s Kenneth Lewis has made some questionable private deals, but he is a master at negotiating with the government and leveraging a weak hand to cover his missteps, The Deal Professor says.
lead_paragraph: Ken Lewis, the embattled chief executive of Bank of America, rose to power through his deal-making, assembling a vast financial conglomerate. But nothing compares to his deal-making of the past two years.

headline.main: Ken Lewis, the Master Government Negotiator
